share if you like =)

Tom Hanoldt artist - developer - human

I am a full stack developer, web designer and artist from Berlin. I came in touch with computer technology in the late 90s and played around a lot with it.

Finally I became self employed and I love the idea of open source and collaborations. So take a look about what I am doing and drop me a line if you think so =)

↹

work life

I developed web games before I startet studying Ba.Sc. Media Informatics at the Beuth University of Applied Sciences . My graduation work was a Node.js server and AdobeAIR client as Dropbox alternative.

GameArt Studio GmbH (2007 - 2012)

As full stack developer of the first hour I did my first steps with high availability and scaling technologies at GameArt Studio. Our main stack was php, java, apache2 and bash scripts. We were among the first commercial user of mysql-cluster.

Käuferportal GmbH (2012 - 2015)

As part of the frontend team at Käuferportal I had a lot to do with mobile optimisation, wordpress and ruby on rails. Also with all sorts of modern web technologies, deployment and agile development.

Rank a Brand Foundation (2016 - now)

For Rank a Brand I am coordinating the development and relaunch of the website and their services. We are a loose coupled team of volunteers and work on a modern stack with php (yii2), gulp, sass, coffeescript, docker and chef.

Creative-Workflow (2015 - now)

In the beginning of 2015 I got self employed as Creative-Workflow. I did a lot of optimisation for customer projects, build up infrastructures, implemented websites and did consulting.

skills

About the years I accumulated a wide and deep knowledge about different technologies, approaches and scientific work. It is no question of what language we use to implement things, it is a question of what concepts and language patterns fit the best. Below a list of services I offer:

  • analysis, planning, conceptualisation
  • web technologies, responsive design, pagespeed, seo
  • algorithms, optimisation, testing
  • agile development, scrum, kanban, git etc.
  • infrastructure, chef, docker, aws
  • consulting, workshops, trainings
